author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: NaNoWriMo, Tuesday nights
text:
NaNoWriMo, Tuesday nights Oct 21, 2015 
Rockport — November is National Novel Writing Month, created as a way to jumpstart those who have a book they have been trying to finish — or start — writing. 
The Rockport Public Library, 1 Limerock St., will be open to writers of any age every Tuesday night in November from 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. as a quiet space for people to work on their books. The library also will supply inspiration in the form of coffee and pie. 
For more information on the annual writing exercise, visit nanowrimo.org . 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
